text:
[Resources Landing Page, Workflow & Automation]
Hi guys!
what’s you best way to create a landing page and associated workflow when you publish a new resources.
We write a lot of gated resource and currently for each one i need to do:
 - a new landing page.
 - on which i use one of my “download resource form” which take an hidden field with the name of the resource (populate in JS)
 - on form submit, i create a new workflow (if form submit and hidden field == my resource - so i have one workflow per resources) which send an email with a CTA with a link toward the resources.

That’s lot of manual work for each resource. Am i missing something?
You could group them into a Campaign then you can clone the contents of that Campaign all at once. Then you need to go and edit the Lading Page, Form and Workflow
Of course you could make a script for all that, but that’s not a trivial job in my opinion

I didn’t know that we can clone campaign content so i already learn something.
Still, that cloning and editing manually.
Thanks Zach :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi. The client on a project are using the starter pack from HubSpot. I have to integrate a form but with the starter level you can't integrate a form on an external page as html element. It generates an iframe and I can't access the lements inside the iframe...Does someone have a solution?

I don't think you have many options. You could use javascript to access inside the iframe but if the form and the page are two different domains anything you try to do will most likely give errors because of cross-origin policies

Hi everyone, my team and I created a custom module for sections that need to include forms.  Overall we are happy with the results but noticed that from the page editor, our content team do not see the options from the screenshot below.  I tried to reverse engineer the default HubSpot form module but these two fields were locked.  Does anyone know of a solution where I can get these two options to appear within a custom module from the page editor view?
yes
thanks for the feedback
Hi Jim, I hope all is well! Do you mind sending me a dm with the module? I can take a look if you’d like.

Hi <@U26ELK908> this is a problem with using forms within a custom module, we have figured out how to add with Hubl the second option but we haven't succeed with the first, great if anyone knows a fix for this
Thanks for your reply!  My team and I chose to go the custom module route because we wanted a scalable and customizable solution but I definitely understand what you mean.  I’m glad I asked.
Any reason why an email template can't contain an RSS Listing Module? I have an older template that has one in it but I cant seem to add this to a new one.

Repost - Make sure to join <#CJ5DN6RKP|email-development> if you build out email on HubSpot :slightly_smiling_face:
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CEQQ9NFK2/p1556127403013100>
great first post for the new channel <#CJ5DN6RKP|email-development> :slightly_smiling_face:
cross posted in there
Another quick question on the `datetimeformat()` how do it get just month without the zero padding?
look like it can be done by using `%-m`, this should be added to the documentation if possible

Our team noticed if you send a 1-to-1 email, and someone clicks the ‘unsubscribe’ link that you can append on to it (in your CRM communication area in the HubSpot user preferences settings), This is the unsubscribe page they are brought to, not the default one HubSpot provides that you can edit.

Is this intended? And if so, if this page customizable or can we change the link to the normal unsubscribe page? Seems odd there is a entirely separate page thats hosted on sidekick.
hi, dennis here, first time caller, long time listener.  what does the default search actually search?
Hi Dennis, thank you for listening. The default search searches all pages and blog posts on your site, including dynamic pages.
This Jon McLaren, signing off
jon, i love your work.  thanks for getting in touch.  strangely, have a blog that isnt being searched.
think i may chat up HubSpot customer service on this one
I think Mcoley once said it can take a little while for blog posts to show up
so if it’s just not showing a new post that could be it
it has been a week :disappointed:
and there are only 5 posts

We have the exact same struggle. A lot of gated content, use the same progressive form on all of them, but create unique landing pages and workflows to send an email with the content on form submission. Would also love to hear more efficient ways people are doing it.

One thing we've just started doing is instead of creating a separate workflow for each, have one workflow and enroll contacts based on form submission. Then the first step divide it up based on which form they submitted so we could send the email. It's the exact same amount of work, but just keeps the Workflows page a little cleaner because we have one really wide workflow for all the similar form submissions instead of individual workflows. One thing we noticed though is you can't set a condition by campaign in workflows which is very annoying.

Another workaround we did that saved us a lot of time, but won't work in most cases, is we had a dozen similar landing pages with the same form to email the gated content. We used one workflow and only one email. We did this by passing a hidden value in the form and then using this as the last part of the URL of the actual content that needed to be sent in the email. We couldn't change the language of the email for each piece of content, but they were all similar so we didn't need to. Basically the hidden field set a contact property, then in the email the link to download the content was something like `<http://path.to/file/HIDDENFIELDPROPERTY.pdf>`

<@UD53A9UUR> I had a similar issue last week with dynamic pages not showing up in search results. Matt Coley did a manually reindex on the back end and the pages still didn't show up in search results. He then reached out to 'the guy that works on content search' and the problem was magically resolved later that day. So you just need to find 'the guy that works on content search'. :smile: Or perhaps Mcoley and point you in the right direction.
<@U6GNQ7JBU>, who is "the guy"
support is "looking into it"
<@UD5NW4PJ5>
danke!
<@UD5NW4PJ5>, if you're willing...
dm some details :slightly_smiling_face:
Good to know, thank you!

For the second part and to improve the way i create landing page i may test something like this:
Create a page using dynamic row from HubDb.
This DB will contain all our resources (which is something we already have) and display them on a page.
And the “dynamic table” option will create a sub page for each of my resources. After that, a few dropdown select in the hubdb table to choose from different template option/form to display per resources, and a nice work on the template, and each new resources added to the DB will have his landing page and a form without having to be created/cloned/edited manually
does anyone know if you can roll back/update the contact property "Contact priority" (hs_predictivescoringtier)

Hi there,
is there a Slack Space for HubSpot less “developer”, more “user” oriented?

There is a community for that, but we did not use Slack as the platform. :slightly_smiling_face:

You can check out the CMS for non-coders community here: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Blog-Website-Page-Publishing/bd-p/content_publishing>
